TopicTitle: Mun return mission - Parachutes are evil

Articles.Content:
To start off my new save in 0.20, I sent a rocket to the Mun and planted a flag. Unfortunately that rocket was unable to return due to low fuel and no parachute; I hadn't really intended to bring Munnand Kerman home after Jeb stole the only rocket with the parachute and returned to a field a long way from KSC (he's still there).

Anyway, the trip went well enough; Gregsy landed on the Mun, Munnand moved "Lander I" closer to the spot to make Gregsy think he'd done a good job despite landing 16km away from the target. They set off home, returned to 100km Kerbin orbit, corrected the inclination and burned retrograde to land at KSP. They re-entered the atmosphere, slowed down enough to land at KSC (almost, 15km away in the end ) and then I just sat back and waited for the parachute to deploy.

2km

1.5km

1.0km

800m

700m - Yay! Parachu- Oh...er...

At this point it's probably best to show the lander as it was:

That's two of the new 1m pods on top of each other, Munnand in the bottom one, fuel tanks with 909s and a parachute on top.

Of course, the inevitable happened. The two command pods split apart at 70m/s when the parachute deployed, Gregsy floated down to the ground, Munnand started to accelerate again and I wondered why I had bothered to waste 15 minutes getting that guy back if all he was going to do was crash.

700m isn't very far when travelling at 70m/s, but it allowed enough time to switch craft (]), throttle up to maximum and decelerate to 10m/s before hitting the ground - Intact

Gregsy landed a few seconds later.

So that's that, a boring Mun-and-back mission that ended with a nice surprise

Moral of the story: MOAR STRUTS (and probably boosters, because this is KSP) (or just slow down before the parachute opens).
Jupp, never prise the day befor it ends. At lest made it back in 2 pices^^
